revised_title: Effect of Conductors on the Rate of Propagation of Electrical Disturbances Along a Wire
tldr: The author investigates the effect of conductors on the rate of propagation of electrical disturbances along a wire, using Maxwell's theory. They find that the rate of propagation is influenced by the capacity of the wire and the surrounding dielectric, and that the velocity of propagation does not depend on the specific resistance of the wire.
